ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned basic chem lab techniques, how to write a lab report, and how to create a graph using data in Excel.
Knowledge of foundational chemistry laboratory skills and reinforcement of concepts learned in CHEM 161 lecture and discussion section

I developed how to handle laboratory equipmrnt for the first time (burets, pipettes, electrical circuits, scales, etc) as well as how to conduct chemical reactions and write formal lab reports/abstracts.

I practiced important laboratory techniques (explaining topics under discussion in CHEM 161 and other basic sanitary practices), in addition to developing the necessary skills to author chemistry lab reports.
How to follow direction and plan far ahead for labs.
I developed my communication and collaborative skills as well as technical laboratory skills necessary for subsequent labs.
I developed lab report writing skills an learned lab techniques.
Basic laboratory skills in measuring, timing, observing, recording and reporting. I also learnt the qualitative part of it in terms of data analysis and writing lab reports
I developed basic lab safety skills and learned standard measurement procedures in chemistry experiments. I also learned how to write a lab report and paper abstract.
Writing reports, following directions, teamwork

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I thought that some of the lab reports were absurdly long.

Strengths: Workshops to work on lab reports with TF and professor help, spread-out lab report due dates, could ask questions about lab procedure in-class whenever necessary
Weaknesses: No specific significant weaknesses

The strength of the course is that it is very hands-on, so you learn a lot from just doing.

A weakness is that at least for this year, the lab didnt align with the classes (it was almost a week forward) so a lot of planning/working ahead was needed.
I don't feel that the pre-lab quizzes were extremely helpful, but I really appreciated having access to a TA who could answer my questions and offer advice.
Time management was a major weakness of mine: could have been improved by making a schedule
Strengths include the size of the groups so we were able to work closely with our TAs. No weaknesses.
I enjoyed writing abstracts, I wish the requirements for graphs were made clearer.

Strengths; I think its well structured in terms of experiment aligning with what we are taught in class. Having workshops once in a while in place of lab was a great way to get qns answered. Experiments were fun structured and you receive enough help from your TA.

Weakness : Not enough feedback is given for the lab reports and every TA grades differently but at least its anonymous.

strengths: the pre-lab lectures and lab manuals are very helpful resources to be more prepared for lab, they are also helpful when completing pre-lab quizzes, Dr. Parr and the TAs were also very helpful throughout each lab session

weaknesses: lab reports could be somewhat difficult to complete, it is often necessary to compare with peers or ask questions, lab reports can also be quite time consuming
Very clear, good professors

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Only if it is prerequisite requirement.
Yes if you are taking CHEM 161 and/or need to fulfill a prerequisite major or pre-medical school requirement

Although the workload is a bit rough for a half/credit course, I would strongly suggest that students still take it because they learn a lot of lab skills and lab writing skills that is useful for other STEM classes, especially those in pre-med.
It is a prerequisite, so yes.
I would not recommend this course to another student who is not required to take this class.
I would recommend lab if you need it for pre-med.
Yes, most definitely.
Yes I feel like its good for basic laboratory skills especially if you are a STEM major

Yes, I would recommend this course. I think the teaching team and Dr. Parr did their best to help us each week and I think with good preparation, completing the experiments accurately and the lab reports at high quality are very manageable. Also, this course fulfills requirements that many students in the life-sciences need. Also pre-med requirement!
Yes, it allows you to apply many of the principles needed in labs and research.
